text: Cloud I ask for question to get deals of hubsport via api?

Hiya! When you select everything in the HubSpot IDE and press shift+tab every line of code will be perfectly indented, is there a vscode plugin that does the same. We recently moved to local development rather than using the HubSpot IDE but using shift tab is such a muscle memory for me that i keep messing up my own indentation :disappointed:
What you can do is use a richtext module, then within the editor of it go to advanced -> source code. In here you can freely drop any html, it also supports HubL :smile:

Hi. I am trying to do some optimizations for our pages to improve page loading speed and core web vitals. If I try to preload some images and fonts, the domain is different that the actual domain of the page. Thus the preloaded assets are not being used. Has anyone had this problem before?
I am loading the images from the src inside the module while the fonts from the theme itself using get_asset_url

Hi. We have an interesting (IMO) challenge. We are working with an organization that will be running a program that enrolls and manages 2000+ students in a virtual summer math program using Zoom. During the enrollment process, both student and parent information will be recorded, and receive emails. We will create a field to identify if a contact is a parent or student. We need the ability to link family members together. We would like to use Company as the family index, but since families do not have domains (at least most don't :-)) we need to find another way to use Companies or another key to link the family members. My initial thought was to use a custom object to link the family members, but I am not a developer, so I am not sure that is a viable solution. Please DM me if anyone has any ideas or experience solving an issue like this. Thank You!
DNS validation is automatic. If you’re still seeing it say this a day later consider contacting HubSpot Support. <http://help.HubSpot.com|help.HubSpot.com>
<@U01QVR44MEY> I don't believe there is any HubSpot documentation for how to "turn off HubSpot automatic tracking"?

Custom Object definitely sound like the way to go here, alternatively you could probably use dummy domains in   company’s something like
lastname.family
actually, scrap that last idea. with the amounts of smith’s in the US alone you’ll have tons of duplicates. I would opt for custom objects then

Hi there, my team is currently in the process of converting a website to be entirely on HubSpot. Currently they only have a handful of landing pages on HubSpot, using a subdomain. As we begin to set up their new blog, I noticed that only the subdomains are available for the URL, rather than the generic HubSpot URL that the website pages are using (since we haven't added the root domain yet as their site is still live).

I was wondering if this is just because we haven't added that root domain yet, or does a blog HAVE to live on a subdomain? (ie <http://blog.mysite.com|blog.mysite.com> vs <http://mysite.com/blog|mysite.com/blog> - we'd prefer the latter if possible).
I also think custom objects is a good idea
Yeah I was talking about doNotTrack
If you don't mind me asking why isn't it a viable option?
Understood, yeah this is because HubSpot keeps your account alive for 90 days have being deactivated so that you can recover it.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/recover-your-inactive-HubSpot-account#:~:text=Free%20accounts%20will%20be%20deactivated,and%20can't%20be%20recovered>.
Yeah something like this might be all you need: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/add-a-google-map-to-HubSpot-content>
CMD+K, CMD+F does it for me in VS Code
It tells me that that is not a command, is it not an extension you have downloaded?
I'll check now
So first I select everything with CMD A and then do that
Same thing, tells me the same
Here's what I see:
Seems like a system command for me
does "format selection" show up in the command pallet?
Palette
No, only format document, but that tells me there is no formatter for html-hubl files

Because it adds an additional cookie, as opposed to blocking the original analytics cookies from dropping in the first place. Head of legal dpt for the client says this is not a GDPR compliant solution because the law states the analytics cookies should not be dropped in the first place if consent is not provided, not simply that data should not be tracked.

And because HubSpot applies these analytics cookies automatically, and I can't control the placement of script to configure an "auto-blocking" mechanism, they are dropped no matter what
It can live on the root domain, you're not forced to use a subdomain
Here it is: <https://github.com/HubSpot/prettier-plugin-hubl>
Well the pop up is gone now but i honestly dont see much happening when i tell it to format :confused:
Thanks!
ok, thanks
Do I need to be a developer to create the field or should it be doable without code?
oh interesting

Thank you in advance!
